comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Bingo! She is the warship 'Kongo', aka 'Kon-go', a "Japanese Training Vessel". It was June 1898. Full details in the AT&CJ 25/6/1998 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71287855 - including a photograph by none other than ... ... [drumroll] ... ... W. F. Hall, Sydney. I think he was standing at Mrs Macquaries Chair for both photos. [information found via a Trove search for " japanese navy barque " limited to the 1890s - sometimes it is just too easy!]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Great find! Thank you so much for the article link, was hoping we would find that W F Hall image in the collectio but no luck as yet! What a great find. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46]  Thanks to you both for identifying the landmarks in the background :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] An idea not backed up by any facts  - when the photographer had a photo chosen by a newspaper for publication,  he might have had to surrender the glass negative for copyright and/or technical printing reasons?  I don't know - just guessing.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] That would seem most likely, but every now and then one of our collection pops up in the papers! It is a bit of a treasure hunt :) Eg a Hood pic of a movie star & his wife appears in the AWW
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Oh good - bang goes that idea!
